content.description: Stand start with your left hand on a good jug/side-pull and right hand on the side-pull rail. Head straight up the boulder using a great right hand pinch to some sloppers. Mantel the lip to an easy top-out.
content.location: See beta photo for line drawing.

content.description: Stand start with left hand on the great pinch used for "Who is Jeff Smith" and right hand up on the slopper rail. Work the slopper rail to the right to gain the biggest jug and bring up a high foot to pull a difficult mantel.
content.location: To the right of "Who is Jeff Smith". See photo for route line.

content.description: Awkward sit. Sort of hidden rh start hold and a lh crimp.  Climb straight up.
Sit start with both hands down low on the slope rail. Traverse right onto the good pinch and finish by doing The Karate Kid.
content.location: Far left of the wednesday night boulder

content.description:
A secluded boulder off the Jeff Smith trail. It stands about 12 feet tall and holds a handful of problems. There are two problems that prove to be a challenge and make it a worth-while destination. Other problems are V-Easy and serve as a good warm-up. There is an easy down-climb off of the back-side that makes this a good place for beginners. 

 Maybe I shouldn't have said "secluded", as there is another boulder in close proximity. However, the other boulder only has a few v-easy problems making for more good practice/warm-ups.
